form.title: Childcare Voucher Application
form.description: Step-by-step form for applying for Childcare Assistance

sections.title: MyCity Consent
sections.content:
In connection with this application for child care services, **MyCity**:

- Collects, processes, stores, and shares the information you submit to screen you when you apply for child care services;
- Receives, processes, and stores the information the City already knows about you to screen you when you apply for child care services;
- Uses your information to improve MyCity; and
- Communicates with you about your MyCity account.

---

If you consent, the following information may be shared between child care services agencies:

- Demographic and background information, including address, phone number, household composition.
- Housing information, including benefits awarded/received, current housing/shelter status.
- Benefits information, including public assistance awarded/received, child care program participation.

---

If you choose not to consent, **you will not be denied** any benefits or services you are receiving or any benefits for which you are eligible.

The [MyCity Privacy Policy](https://www.nyc.gov/privacy) details how MyCity handles the information you submit through MyCity.

sections.title: Application Instructions
sections.content:
**Let’s get started on your application!**

To complete this application, you will be asked for information about:

- Yourself
- Your household
- Your employment or reason for care
- Your income

All required fields are marked and must be filled out to move forward with the application. The pages of the application are shown on the right-hand side of the screen and will be highlighted as you move through the application.

Your application will be saved automatically as you progress to each page.  
If you need to pause at any time, click the **“Save for later”** button at the bottom of each page to save your application.  
You can log back in to resume your application.

When you’re ready to begin, click **“Next”** below.

---

⚠️ **Important:**  
To keep your information current and safe, applications in draft status that you have not edited for **30 days** will be deleted.  
If your draft application is deleted, you can still create and submit a new application when you're ready to apply.

sections.title: New York City Residency
sections.content:
You will need to upload **ONE** of the following documents to confirm your NYC residency:

- IDNYC
- Driver’s License
- Utility Bill (dated within the last 60 days, with your address)
- Current lease, rent, or mortgage statement (dated within the last 60 days, with your address)
- Section 8 Award Letter
- NYCHA Certificate
- CFWB-027 Housing Attestation with address listed
- Shelter Residency Letter with address listed

If you do not have any of those documents, you must submit a **CFWB-067 Residency Attestation**.

sections.title: Children Documents
sections.content:
### Citizenship or Immigration Status
These documents confirm the citizenship or immigration status of the children in your family for whom you’re applying for child care assistance. Please upload one of the following documents for each child needing care. *Do not upload these documents for children who do not need care.*

- Birth Certificate from US state or territory
- Alien Registration Card including Permanent Resident or Green Card
- Passport
- FS-240 (Consular Report of Birth Abroad)
- Naturalization Certificate
- Other documentation that proves child’s immigration status

### Child's Relationship to Applicant
These documents confirm your relationship to the children in your household under age 18. Please upload one of the following documents for every child in the household under age 18, regardless of whether they need child care.

- Birth certificate
- Adoption record
- Baptismal record
- Passport with parent's signature
- Court order for legal guardian with financial responsibility
- Letter of guardianship
- Other - CFWB-058 Caretaker Attestation

If you are not the child's parent or stepparent, you must submit a **CFWB-058 Caretaker Attestation Form**.

### Age of Children
You will need to upload **ONE** of the following documents for every child in the household under age 18, regardless of whether child care is needed for them:

- Birth certificate
- Adoption record
- Baptismal record
- Alien Registration Card
- Passport
- Official hospital documentation of the child’s birth

sections.title: Employment & Income
sections.content:
### Income
These documents confirm your family’s income.

---

### If You Are Employed
If you are employed and receive paystubs, you must submit them to confirm your income. The number of paystubs you must submit varies by how often you get paid and whether your payment amount is the same or different each time you are paid – see the table below for details. Submit the most recent paystub you have received, followed by others in consecutive order.

**Income Information**

| How Often Do You Get Paid? | Always the SAME Amount | DIFFERENT Amounts Each Time |
|----------------------------|-------------------------|------------------------------|
| Weekly (Every Week) | 4 most recent, consecutive pay stubs | 12 most recent, consecutive pay stubs |
| Bi-Weekly (Every Two Weeks) | 2 most recent, consecutive pay stubs | 6 most recent, consecutive pay stubs |
| Semi-Monthly (Two Times Per Month) | 2 most recent, consecutive pay stubs | 6 most recent, consecutive pay stubs |
| Monthly (One Time Per Month) | 3 most recent, consecutive pay stubs | 3 most recent, consecutive pay stubs |

If you do not have any paystubs, you must submit a **CFWB-015 Referral to Employer for Employee Income Information Form**.

---

### If You Are Self-Employed
If you have been self-employed for **one year or more**, you must submit a current, complete and signed income tax package (e.g., 1040, 1065, Schedule C, SE for partnership, K-1, etc.).

If you have been self-employed for **less than one year**, you must submit a **CFWB-031 Self-Employment Income Information Attestation Form**.

---

### Other Income
If you receive other types of income outside or instead of employment income, you must submit your most recent check, pay stub, or current award letter that indicates the amount you receive. If your other income fluctuates, **3 months of documentation is required**.

This includes, but is not limited to:
- Income from SSI, SSD
- Unemployment benefits
- Rental income
- Pensions
- Annuities
- Worker’s compensation
- Alimony
- Child support

sections.title: Reason for Care
sections.content:
### Reason for Care
These documents confirm your reason for care. Every applicant must have a qualified reason for care; in a two-parent household, parents or caretakers can have the same or different reasons for care. Only the documents related to your stated reasons for care need to be uploaded, and documentation must be uploaded for all parent or caretakers in the household.

---

### Working 10+ Hours Per Week
Your employment or self-employment income documents will cover this reason for care. You do not need to submit additional documentation.

---

### Participating in an Educational or Vocational Training Program
You will need to upload **ONE** of the following documents to confirm your participation in vocational school, two-year college, or four-year college.

- CFWB-005 Vocational, Education and Training Verification Form
- A letter from the educational or vocational training program on their official letterhead; this letter must contain all the information required in the CFWB-005 Vocational, Education and Training Verification Form.

---

### Looking for Work
You will need to upload **ONE** of the following documents to confirm that you are looking for work.

- CFWB-026 Work Search Record Form
- Approved work search plan from the NYS Dept. of Labor
- Proof of receipt of unemployment insurance

---

### Experiencing Homelessness
You will need to upload **ONE** of the following documents to confirm that you are experiencing homelessness. This includes families who may be living in shelter or sharing the housing of others due to loss of housing, economic hardship, or similar reason.

- Shelter Residency Letter (If living in Shelter, including Humanitarian Emergency Relief Centers)
- CFWB-027 Housing Attestation (If living doubled-up, in a place not meant for human habitation, in a hotel/motel, or in another living situation)

---

### Attending Services for Domestic Violence
You will need to upload a referral for services from a domestic violence service provider to confirm that you are attending services for domestic violence.

---

### Attending Services for Substance Abuse Treatment
You will need to upload a referral for a substance abuse treatment service provider to confirm that you are attending services for substance abuse treatment.

sections.title: Additional Details
sections.content:
### Application Scope
This application is used to apply **only** for **Category 2 or 3 child care assistance** (for families not in receipt of cash assistance). To apply for **Cash Assistance** or other benefits, including **Category 1 Child Care Assistance** (for families in receipt of cash assistance), you must use the **New York State Application for Certain Benefits and Services (LDSS-2921)**.

---

### Exempt Applicants
The following applicants may be eligible for child care assistance **without regard to income** and do not need to complete this application:

- Foster parents who need child care assistance to allow them to work and are only applying for assistance for the foster children;
- Families in receipt of protective or preventive services.

---

### Application Completion
All sections of this form must be filled out to be considered complete **unless the section is identified as optional**. If you do not complete all required sections of this form, you may not be considered for Child Care Assistance.

---

### Rights and Responsibilities
You may obtain information about your rights and responsibilities [here](https://otda.ny.gov/programs/applications/). If you do not have access to the internet, you can call the **Administration for Children’s Services at 212-835-7610** to request that physical copies of the booklets which highlight your rights and responsibilities be mailed to you, including:

- **LDSS-4148A**: What You Should Know About Your Rights and Responsibilities
- **LDSS-4148B**: What You Should Know About Social Services Programs
- **LDSS-4148C**: What You Should Know If You Have an Emergency

fields.label: Date of Birth
fields.tooltip: To edit Date of Birth click on NYC MyCity in the top-left corner then click on Account Settings.

fields.label: Marital Status
fields.tooltip: Indicate your marital status (single, married, divorced, separated or widowed).

fields.label: Mobile or Other Phone
fields.tooltip: To edit Telephone (Cell or Other) click on NYC MyCity in the top-left corner then click on Account Settings and then click on Contact.

fields.label: Email
fields.tooltip: To edit email, go to NYC ID Profile tab by clicking your name at the top right corner

sections.title: Address
sections.tooltip: To edit home address click on NYC MyCity in the top-left corner then click on Account Settings.

fields.label: Street Address
fields.tooltip: To edit home address click on NYC MyCity in the top-left corner then click on Account Settings.

fields.label: Is Temporary Address
fields.tooltip: Check YES if you are currently living in a homeless shelter, doubled-up with another family, in a hotel/motel, in a car/ bus/ train, in a park/campsite, or other temporary accomodation.

fields.label: Race
fields.tooltip: You may choose multiple race categories. Providing race information is voluntary and will not affect your eligibility for Child Care Assistance or the amount of assistance that you will be given by this agency.

fields.label: Social Security Number
fields.tooltip: To edit social security number click on NYC MyCity in the top-left corner then click on Account Settings.

fields.label: Primary Language
fields.tooltip: Select the language that is spoken most often in your household. If “other”, provide the name of the language.

fields.label: Preferred Language
fields.tooltip: Select the language you prefer to communicate in. If “other”, provide the name of the language.

fields.label: First Name
fields.tooltip: Provide the first name, last name, and middle initial of each child you are applying for child care assistance for.

fields.label: Date of Birth
fields.tooltip: Provide the date of birth.

fields.label: Sex
fields.tooltip: Select to indicate the sex.

fields.label: Ethnicity Hispanic or Latino
fields.tooltip: Check “YES” or “NO” to indicate if each child in need of child care is Hispanic or Latino or not. Providing ethnicity information is voluntary and will not affect your eligibility for child care assistance or the amount of assistance that you will be given by this agency.

fields.label: Race
fields.tooltip: You may choose multiple race categories for a single child. Providing race information is voluntary and will not affect your eligibility for Child Care Assistance or the amount of assistance that you will be given by this agency.

fields.label: Social Security Number
fields.tooltip: Provide each child’s Social Security Number (SSN). You are not required to provide SSNs. They may be used by federal, state, and local agencies to prevent duplication of services and fraud, and for Federal Reporting.

fields.label: Do both parents reside in the home?
fields.tooltip: Check “YES” or “NO” to indicate whether both of the child’s parents live in the home.

fields.label: Does the child have a disability?
fields.tooltip: Check “YES” or “NO” to indicate whether the child needing child care has a disability.

fields.label: Is child U.S. Citizen, U.S. National, or person with satisfactory immigration status?
fields.tooltip: You will only be asked about the immigration status of the children in need of care. Other members of the family will not need to state or prove their immigration status. Your child will be eligible for care if they are a U.S. citizen, a legal permanent resident (green card holder), a refugee, or an asylee; have a T-visa; or hold another qualified immigration status. Please select “Yes” if your child holds one of these statuses.

sections.title: Household Members Information
sections.content:
**List the household members who do _not_ need child care.**

If applicable, list:

- Your **spouse**, your child’s **second parent**, **caretaker**, or **step-parent**
- Any other **adult with whom you share a child**, if they live in your home

Then, if applicable, list:

- Any **siblings under the age of 18** who live in your home

> **Only list other household members** — such as **aunts, uncles, cousins, grandparents, or friends** — _if they have financial responsibility_ for the child.

A household member with financial responsibility, other than a parent or step-parent, is one who has a **letter or order of guardianship**.

**Otherwise, do not include them.**

sections.title: Household Member Details
sections.description: Include household members who do not need child care assistance (e.g., spouse, partner, other children).

fields.label: First Name
fields.tooltip: Provide last and first name, and middle initial if applicable.

fields.label: Relationship to Applicant
fields.tooltip: Provide each person’s relationship to you (e.g. spouse, partner, child, foster parent, other).

fields.label: Date of Birth
fields.tooltip: Provide the family member's date of birth.

fields.label: Sex
fields.tooltip: Indicate the sex for each family member listed.

fields.label: Ethnicity Hispanic or Latino
fields.tooltip: Check “YES” or “NO” to indicate if each member in the household is Hispanic or Latino or not. Providing ethnicity information is voluntary and will not affect your eligibility for Child Care Assistance or the amount of assistance that you will be given by this agency.

fields.label: Race
fields.tooltip: You may choose multiple race categories for a single person. Providing race information is voluntary and will not affect your eligibility for Child Care Assistance or the amount of assistance that you will be given by this agency.

fields.label: Social Security Number
fields.tooltip: Fill in the Social Security Number (SSN) for your family members. SSN is optional. SSN may be used by federal, state, and local agencies to prevent duplication of services and fraud, and for Federal Reporting.

sections.title: Reason for Child Care Assistance
sections.description: Select one or two reasons you are requesting Child Care Assistance.
sections.tooltip: Select one reason. In a two-parent household, parents/caretakers can have the same or different reasons for needing child care. Both parents/caretakers will be required to submit documentation in support of their own reason. If you are living in temporary housing, please select Homelessness even if you have another reason that applies to you.

sections.title: Military and Parental Availability
sections.description: Provide information about parental military status and availability for child care.

fields.label: Is a Parent Currently Active Full-Time in the U.S. Military?
fields.tooltip: Check “YES” or “NO” to indicate whether a parent is currently active full-time in the U.S. Military.

fields.label: Is a Parent a Member of National Guard or Military Reserve Unit?
fields.tooltip: Check “YES” or “NO” to indicate whether a parent is currently a member of a National Guard or Military Reserve Unit.

fields.label: Is the Non-Custodial Parent Available to Provide Care?
fields.tooltip: Check “YES” or “NO” to indicate whether there is a non-custodial parent available to provide child care.

sections.title: Other Applications
sections.description: Indicate if you are also applying for or receiving child care from other agencies.
sections.tooltip: Indicate whether you are currently receiving or have applied for child care assistance with one of the agencies or organizations listed below. Note: If you are receiving Cash Assistance and are interested in child care assistance, you must apply through the Human Resources Administration. Reach out to your Benefits Access Center or visit the Human Resources Administration webpage.

fields.label: Are You Receiving or Applying for Child Care Through Another Agency?

options: Department of Youth and Community Development (DYCD)

fields.label: Does applicant earn any income/ wages from employment?
Does Coparent/2nd Guardian earn any income/ wages from employment?

sections.title: Applicant Employment Information
sections.description: Enter details for up to two jobs held by the applicant.

sections.title: Second Parent Employment Information
sections.description: Enter details for up to two jobs held by the second parent (if applicable).

sections.title: Schedule Information
sections.content:
Please indicate what days and hours you will need child care for based on your reason for care.

- **Employed**: Indicate the hours you attend work
- **Educational or Vocational Program**: Indicate the hours you attend school or your program
- **Looking for Work**: Indicate the hours you spend looking for work
- **Homeless**: Indicate the hours you spend looking for housing
- **Attending Services for Domestic Violence**: Indicate the hours you attend services.
- **Attending Services for Substance Abuse Treatment**: Indicate the hours you attend services.

sections.title: First Parent Activity Schedule
sections.description: Enter the start and end times for each day of the week for the first parent's activities.

rowCopy.copyControlLabel: Apply selected schedule to other weekdays

sections.title: Second Parent Activity Schedule
sections.description: Enter the start and end times for each day of the week for the second parent's activities.

rowCopy.copyControlLabel: Apply selected schedule to other weekdays

sections.title: First Parent Travel Time
sections.description: Enter the travel times and method of transport for the first parent.

fields.label: Drop-off Travel Time
fields.tooltip: Select your typical travel time from work/activity to your child care provider

fields.label: Pick-up Travel Time
fields.tooltip: Select your typical travel time from work/activity to your child care provider

fields.label: Public Transport for Drop-off?
fields.tooltip: Indicate if the applicant uses public transportation to travel to and from work/activity to provider.

fields.label: Public Transport for Pick-up?
fields.tooltip: Indicate if the applicant uses public transportation to travel to and from work/activity to provider.

sections.title: Second Parent Travel Time
sections.description: Enter the travel times and method of transport for the second parent.

sections.title: Instructions
sections.content:
Please include income/benefits information for yourself and, if applicable, your spouse, your child’s second caretaker, and/or any other adult with whom you share a child, if they live in your home.

Indicate if you receive money from the following sources by selecting “Yes” or “No.” If you select “Yes,” you will be asked for additional information.

If the second caretaker in the household also receives the same income source, add a separate line for their income.

sections.title: Income Sources
sections.description: Provide details about all income sources applicable to the applicant or household.

sections.title: Total Household Income
sections.description: Sum of all monthly income across sources.

sections.title: Instructions
sections.content: If you are found eligible for child care assistance, you can choose center-based or home-based care from a licensed, registered, or legally exempt provider. If you choose a provider that is not licensed or registered, the provider must be enrolled as a legally exempt provider.\n\nIf you know which child care providers you would like your child to attend, provide the names and addresses of your choice of providers. You can leave this section blank if you do not know (it will not impact your eligibility and you will have an opportunity to select a provider if determined eligible).

sections.title: Provider Choices
sections.description: Specify details of the provider where you intend to enroll the child(ren).

steps.title: Document Upload
steps.description: The Application for Child Care Assistance (CFWB-012) must include supporting documentation. Check to ensure that documentation is provided for each requirement of subsidy eligibility.

sections.title: New York City Residency
sections.description: These documents confirm that you live in New York City. Please upload one of the following documents.

options: CFWB-027 Housing Attestation with address listed
Shelter Residency Letter with address listed

fields.label: Upload Residency Proof Document
fields.description: To add a document to your application, you can upload an image or scanned file from your phone or device. Accepted formats include .pdf, .gif, .jpeg, .jpg and .png up to 25 MB. Learn how to upload your files with this Tutorial Video.

sections.title: Citizenship or Immigration Status
sections.description: These documents confirm the citizenship/immigration status of the children in your family for whom you’re applying for child care assistance. Please upload one of the following documents for ONLY each child needing care.

options: Alien Registration Card including Permanent Resident or Green Card
FS-240 (Report of Birth Abroad of a U.S. Citizen)

fields.label: Upload Citizenship/Immigration Document
fields.description: To add a document to your application, you can upload an image or scanned file from your phone or device. Accepted formats include .pdf, .gif, .jpeg, .jpg and .png up to 25 MB. Learn how to upload your files with this Tutorial Video.

sections.title: Child’s Relationship to Parent/Applicant
sections.description: These documents confirm your relationship to the children in your household under age 18. Please upload one of the following documents for every child in the household under age 18, regardless of whether child care is needed for them or not. If you are a legal guardian with financial responsibility, you must upload a Court order OR a letter of guardianship.

options: Court order for legal guardian with financial responsibility

fields.label: Upload Relationship Document
fields.description: To add a document to your application, you can upload an image or scanned file from your phone or device. Accepted formats include .pdf, .gif, .jpeg, .jpg and .png up to 25 MB. Learn how to upload your files with this Tutorial Video.

sections.title: Age
sections.description: These documents confirm the age of the children in your household. Please upload one of the following documents for every child in the household under age 18, regardless of whether child care is needed for them:

options: Official hospital documentation of the child’s birth

fields.label: Upload Age Proof Document
fields.description: To add a document to your application, you can upload an image or scanned file from your phone or device. Accepted formats include .pdf, .gif, .jpeg, .jpg and .png up to 25 MB. Learn how to upload your files with this Tutorial Video.
